Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: A minimum grade of "C" (2.0) in PCB 3044 or CI.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Science, history and principles of conservation biology.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Permission of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Priority given to students whose major requires this course. Basic principles and unifying concepts of modern biology. Introduction to quantitative experimentation using intensive, open-ended labs.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Consent of Honors, BSC 2010C and CHM 2046

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A laboratory course which presents the concepts, modern methods, techniques and instrumentation used in quantitative biological and molecular biological experimentation. Honors level content.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MCB 1310, and either CHM 2046 or PHY 2054C   .

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Biological processes in nano scale interactions with elements of physics & engineering.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 2010C and BSC 2011C each with a "C" (2.0) or better, and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A field-based course gathering information on natural history of various organisms in Florida, with special emphasis on scientific methods.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 2010C and CHM 2046

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A laboratory course which presents modern methods and instrumentation used in quantitative biological experimentation.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of various biological factors which affect the health and survival of man in modern society. Designed for non-majors.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A minimum grade of "C" (2.0) in both BSC 2010C and BSC 2011C.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides students with a foundation in the field of marine biology using a global perspective.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: High school biology or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Open only to students whose major requires this specific course. Cellular and chemical basis of life, genetics, and the theory of evolution. Emphasis on problem solving, analysis, synthesis of information, and applying data effectively.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in BSC 2010C or C.I. Preference will be given to students whose program requires this course.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of BSC 2010C. Organismal anatomy and physiology as it relates to biodiversity, ecology and evolution. Emphasis on problem solving, analysis, synthesis of information, and applying data effectively.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The laboratory to accompany BSC 1005.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: STA 2023, BSC 2011C, MAC 2311C, and PCB 3063, or CI.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic concepts in biological software applications and will cover multiple computer languages and biological topics.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in PCB 3044, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: General principles of invasion ecology. The study of addition of species into ecosystems as it provides insights into basic ecological and evolutionary questions.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CHM 2210 and a "C" (2.0) or better in PCB 3044, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Individual and small group instruction in current laboratory techniques beyond the scope of typical Biology laboratories.

BSC3453C - Biological Research Methods a.name: BSC3453C - Biological Research Methods and Experimental Design

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: A grade of "C" or better in both BSC 2011C and STA 2023 and a grade of "C" or better in either PCB 3044 or PCB 3063, permission of Course Instructor.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Research methods in biology, with specific focus on critical thinking, scientific skepticism, experimental design, and working with data relevant to biological questions.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PCB 3522 or PCB 3023 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction of useful bioinformatics tools and resources on RNA and protein structure analysis.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

BSC3843L - Strategies for Biology Academ.name: BSC3843L - Strategies for Biology Academic Mentoring

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Junior or senior standing.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Review research findings, theory, models and techniques of academic counseling and career advising.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 3312 and a "C" (2.0) or better in PCB 3044.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An advanced treatment of current issues in marine biology, emphasizing biodiversity and marine conservation through research, service-learning and field experiences.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PCB 3522 or PCB 3023 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction of useful bioinformatics tools and resources on sequence analysis.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: College of Medicine Burnett School of Biomedical Sciences

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A grade of a "B" (3 .0) or better in PCB 3063 and completion of EHS Lab Safety Training online course and practical by end of add/drop, or instructor consent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Hands-on approach to understanding how genomic datasets are generated in the lab, and how they are analyzed computationally using bioinformatics pipelines.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in BSC 2010C or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A service-learning course utilizing an interdisciplinary approach to developing models and implementing programs designed to result in environmental sustainability.

BSC4927 - Scientific and Public Engageme.name: BSC4927 - Scientific and Public Engagement for Biology Majors

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ENC 1102, Biology major, junior standing, one of the following: PCB3063L, or PCB3044L, or PCB4683L, and by instructor consent. Honors in the Major students are encouraged to register for this course

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Practical experience and training disseminating biological research to a variety of audiences. Build skills in written, verbal, and visual representation of scientific or biological information.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A "C" (2.0) or better in both PCB 3044 and PCB 4683, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of geographic variation in nature, ranging from past to present and genes to ecosystems.

BSC4910C - Group Effort Applied Research.name: BSC4910C - Group Effort Applied Research in Biology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 2011C and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Conduct novel research stemming from the instructor's active research program to become practitioners of science.

BSC4937 - Instructional Experiences in U.name: BSC4937 - Instructional Experiences in Undergraduate Biology

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PCB 3063, Biology major with 80 semester hours and 3.0 gpa.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Preparation of undergraduate students to more effectively learn biological concepts by facilitating learning in variety of university biology labs.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: BSC 1005 or BSC 2010C or EVR 1001, and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Scientific diving and satisfies the 100 hours of training required by the American Academy of Underwater Sciences.
